ground_truth: The scenes begin with music and head credits playing over various bowling shots—pins flying, graceful releases, balls gliding down lanes, bowlers hoisting balls, sliding feet, and a ball return spinning up a ball. The music transitions into boomy source music from a distant jukebox as the credits end over a clattering strike. A lanky blonde man with stringy hair tied back in a ponytail turns from the strike to walk back to the bench. The focus shifts to a big man nursing a large plastic cup of Bud, with dark worried eyes, a goatee, hairy legs emerging from khaki shorts, and wearing a khaki army surplus shirt with the sleeves cut off over an old bowling shirt. Donny, the strike-scoring bowler, enters and sits next to Walter. The Dude, also holding a large plastic cup of Bud, has foam on his mustache. Reflected in a plaque, the Dude is seen entering the room with a young man. The plaque, from Variety Clubs International, honors Jeffrey Lebowski as Achiever of the Year. The Dude, wearing shorts and a bowling shirt, turns to look, as does Brandt, the young man in a suit with his hands clasped in front of his groin. The track and pan reveal a framed Life Magazine cover titled "ARE YOU A LEBOWSKI ACHIEVER?" with the Dude's sunglassed face on it, showing the display is mirrored. A fat sixtyish man in a motorized wheelchair, Jeff Lebowski, enters, wheeling himself behind a desk. The Dude sits facing him as Brandt withdraws. The Dude rises and heads for the door, opens it, and shuts it on the old man's bellowing. Outside, a houseman with a rolled-up carpet on one shoulder walks through a back lawn past a swimming pool to a garage, followed by Brandt and the Dude. They arc around a woman's foot as she finishes painting her nails emerald green, looking up at the Dude. In her early twenties, she leans back and extends her leg toward him. The Dude pulls his sunglasses down his nose, peeks over them, tentatively grabs hold of her extended foot, and she waggles it, giggling. The Dude looks over at the pool, where a man in his thirties with long stringy blond hair is passed out in an inflatable chair.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution

The melody shifts into resonant source melody from a far-off jukebox as the credits cease over a clattering strike. A lanky fair-haired man with stringy locks tied back in a ponytail turns from the strike to stroll back to the bench. The emphasis turns to a large man sipping a sizable plastic cup of Bud, with dark anxious eyes, a goatee, hairy limbs emerging from khaki shorts, and wearing a khaki military excess shirt with the sleeves shorn off over an old bowling shirt. Donny, the strike-scoring player, arrives and seats next to Walter. The Dude, also grasping a sizable plastic cup of Bud, has foam on his mustache. Reflected in a plaque, the Dude is observed entering the chamber with a young man. The plaque, from Variety Clubs International, honors Jeffrey Lebowski as Achiever of the Year. The Dude, wearing shorts and a bowling shirt, turns to glance, as does Brandt, the young man in a suit with his hands clasped in front of his groin. The track and pan unveil a framed Life Magazine cover titled "ARE YOU A LEBOWSKI ACHIEVER?" with the Dude's sunglassed visage on it, indicating the display is mirrored. A corpulent sixtyish man in a motorized wheelchair, Jeff Lebowski, enters, wheeling himself behind a desk. The Dude sits facing him as Brandt retreats. The Dude rises and heads for the portal, opens it, and closes it on the elder man's bellowing. Outside, a houseman with a rolled-up carpet on one shoulder strolls through a rear lawn past a swimming pool to a garage, followed by Brandt and the Dude. They arc around a woman's foot as she finishes painting her nails emerald green, gazing up at the Dude. In her early twenties, she reclines back and extends her limb toward him. The Dude pulls his sunglasses down his nose, peeks over them, tentatively grips her extended foot, and she waggles it, giggling. The Dude gazes over at the pool, where a man in his thirties with long stringy fair locks is passed out in an inflatable chair.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The scenes open with music and head credits over various bowling shots—pins flying, graceful releases, bowls gliding, bowlers hoisting balls, sliding feet, and a spinning ball return. The music shifts to boomy jukebox sounds as a clattering strike marks the end of credits. A lanky blonde man with stringy hair in a ponytail walks back from the strike. Attention turns to a big man with worried eyes and a goatee, wearing khaki shorts and an old bowling shirt beneath a sleeveless army surplus shirt, nursing a cup of Bud. Donny, the bowler, joins Walter. The Dude, also holding a large plastic cup of Bud, has foam on his mustache. A plaque reflects the Dude entering with a young man. It's from Variety Clubs International, honoring Jeffrey Lebowski as Achiever of the Year. The Dude, in shorts and a bowling shirt, looks alongside Brandt, a young man in a suit. They see a Life Magazine cover titled “ARE YOU A LEBOWSKI ACHIEVER?” with the Dude’s face, showing the display is mirrored. A fat man in a motorized wheelchair, Jeff Lebowski, enters. The Dude sits, and Brandt withdraws. The Dude rises, heads out, and shuts the door on the old man’s yelling. Outside, a houseman with a rolled-up carpet walks to a garage, followed by Brandt and the Dude. They pass a woman in her twenties painting her nails, extending her emerald-painted foot to the Dude. He lowers his sunglasses, peeks, holds her foot, and she waggles it, giggling. The Dude looks at the pool, where a man in his thirties with long blond hair is passed out in an inflatable chair.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Scenes start with music and credits over bowling shots—pins flying, balls gliding, bowlers hoisting balls, sliding feet, and a ball return spinning. The music becomes boomy jukebox sounds as credits end with a strike. A lanky blonde man in a ponytail turns from the strike to return to the bench. Focus shifts to a big man with dark eyes, a goatee, khaki shorts, and a sleeveless army shirt sipping Bud. Donny, the strike bowler, sits by Walter. The Dude, holding Bud with foam on his mustache, is seen with a young suit-clad man reflected in a plaque honoring Jeffrey Lebowski. The Dude, in shorts and a bowling shirt, looks at Brandt. A framed Life Magazine cover reads "ARE YOU A LEBOWSKI ACHIEVER?" featuring the Dude's face. Jeff Lebowski, in a motorized wheelchair, enters behind a desk. The Dude faces him, rises, and leaves, shutting the door on the old man's bellowing. Outside, a houseman carries a carpet past a pool to a garage, followed by Brandt and the Dude. They pass a woman painting her nails, who extends her leg to the Dude. He peeks over his sunglasses, grabs her foot, and she giggles. The Dude notices a man with long blond hair passed out in an inflatable chair by the pool.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The opening scenes commence with lively music playing in the background as the head credits roll, accompanied by a series of captivating bowling shots. These shots include pins flying in all directions, bowlers gracefully releasing their balls, the balls themselves smoothly gliding down the highly polished lanes, bowlers skillfully hoisting the heavy balls, sliding feet skimming the floor, and a ball return mechanism spinning up to deliver the next ball. As the sequence progresses, the music transitions seamlessly into a booming source of melody emanating from a distant jukebox just as the credits reach their conclusion over the sound of a clattering strike. 

At this moment, a lanky man with striking blonde hair tied back neatly in a ponytail turns away triumphantly from the strike he scored to make his way back to the bench. The camera then shifts its focus onto a large, imposing man with dark, worried eyes who is nursing an oversized plastic cup filled with Bud beer. This man, sporting a goatee and hairy legs protruding from khaki shorts, is dressed casually in a khaki army surplus shirt—its sleeves have been cut off to reveal his arms—worn over an old, worn bowling shirt. 

The bowler who scored the strike, identified as Donny, enters the scene, making his way over to sit next to the large man named Walter. Simultaneously, the Dude can be seen nearby, also holding an equally large plastic cup brimming with Bud beer, with a frothy mustache to match. Reflected in the gleaming surface of a plaque, the Dude is observed entering the room accompanied by a young man. This distinguished plaque, proudly presented by Variety Clubs International, recognizes Jeffrey Lebowski with the prestigious title of Achiever of the Year.

The Dude, casually attired in shorts and a familiar bowling shirt, turns his gaze toward the plaque. Similarly, Brandt, the young man in a smart suit with his hands demurely clasped in front of his groin, also takes a moment to glance in that direction. The camera tracks and pans to reveal a framed cover of Life Magazine, boldly titled "ARE YOU A LEBOWSKI ACHIEVER?" prominently featuring the Dude's sunglassed face, indicating that the display is, in fact, mirrored. 

A portly man, appearing to be in his sixties, deftly maneuvers into the scene in a motorized wheelchair. This man, Jeff Lebowski, wheels himself purposefully behind a large desk. The Dude takes a seat facing him, but shortly thereafter, rises to make his departure. As Brandt respectfully withdraws from the room, the Dude opens the door to leave, firmly shutting it behind him, cutting off the older man's bellowing voice. 

Outside, a houseman, burdened with carrying a rolled-up carpet on one shoulder, makes his way across a sprawling back lawn, past a sparkling swimming pool, and toward a nearby garage. He is closely followed by Brandt and the Dude, who arc gracefully around the elegantly extended foot of a young woman. She is in her early twenties, finishing painting her nails a striking emerald green, and she looks up at the Dude with a playful expression. Leaning back with confidence, she extends her leg toward him invitingly. The Dude, in response, lowers his sunglasses down his nose to peek over them and, with a degree of hesitance, reaches for her extended foot, giving it a tentative squeeze. The woman giggles, playfully waggling her foot in response. 

The Dude then shifts his gaze over to the pool, where he observes a man in his thirties with long, stringy blond hair, who appears to be completely passed out, lounging in an inflatable chair that floats lazily on the pool's surface.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The opening sequence begins with an energetic and lively tune playing in the background, setting the mood as the initial head credits start to roll. This dynamic introduction is accompanied by a captivating series of shots centered around the sport of bowling. The visuals showcase pins scattering in every direction, bowlers expertly releasing their balls, which then glide effortlessly down the immaculately polished lanes. We see bowlers skillfully lifting and hoisting the heavy bowling balls, their sliding feet skimming gracefully along the smooth floor. Meanwhile, the ball return mechanism whirs into action, spinning up to deliver the next ball to the expectant bowlers. As the sequence unfolds, the music transitions seamlessly, becoming a booming source of melody emanating from a jukebox in the distance, just as the credits reach their conclusion, punctuated by the sound of a clattering strike.

At this pivotal moment, the camera captures a slender man with striking blonde hair neatly tied back into a ponytail. He turns triumphantly from the strike he has just scored and makes his way with assured steps back to the bench. The focus of the camera then shifts onto another character—a large, imposing man with dark and worried eyes. This man is nursing an oversized plastic cup brimming with Bud beer. His appearance is casual; he sports a goatee, and his hairy legs protrude from khaki shorts. He is dressed in a khaki army surplus shirt with the sleeves cut off, revealing his arms, and he wears it over an old, weathered bowling shirt.

The narrative progresses as the bowler who scored the strike, identified as Donny, enters the scene. He makes his way over to sit next to the large man known as Walter. Concurrently, the Dude is visible nearby, holding an equally large plastic cup filled with Bud beer, complete with a frothy mustache that matches. Reflected within the surface of a gleaming plaque, the Dude is seen entering the room, accompanied by a young man. This distinguished plaque, proudly awarded by Variety Clubs International, honors Jeffrey Lebowski with the prestigious title of Achiever of the Year.

Dressed in a laid-back style, the Dude is attired in shorts and a familiar-looking bowling shirt as he turns his gaze thoughtfully toward the plaque. Likewise, Brandt—the young man clad in a smart suit, with his hands demurely clasped before him—also takes a moment to glance in that direction. The camera moves to reveal a framed cover of Life Magazine. This cover boldly asks the question, "ARE YOU A LEBOWSKI ACHIEVER?" prominently featuring the Dude's face, partially hidden by sunglasses, hinting that this display is, in fact, mirrored.

Into this scene deftly maneuvers a portly man, who appears to be in his sixties, moving confidently in a motorized wheelchair. This man, identified as Jeff Lebowski, wheels himself purposefully behind an imposing desk. The Dude takes a seat to face him but soon rises to make his departure. As Brandt discreetly exits the room, the Dude opens the door to leave, closing it firmly behind him, effectively cutting off the older man's bellowing voice.

Outside in the open air, a houseman, burdened with a rolled-up carpet balanced on one shoulder, makes his way across an expansive back lawn. He passes a sparkling swimming pool and heads toward a nearby garage. He is closely followed by Brandt and the Dude, who arc gracefully around the elegantly extended foot of a young woman in her early twenties. She is in the midst of painting her nails a striking shade of emerald green. She looks up at the Dude with a playful, teasing expression and, leaning back with an air of confidence, extends her leg toward him invitingly. In response, the Dude lowers his sunglasses to peek over them and, with some hesitance, reaches out to her extended foot, giving it a tentative squeeze. The woman giggles, waggling her foot playfully in response.

The Dude's gaze then shifts over to the pool, where he observes a man in his thirties. This individual, with long, stringy blond hair, appears to be completely passed out as he lounges in an inflatable chair that floats lazily on the serene surface of the pool.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The video begins with music playing and head credits appearing on screen, interspersed with various shots of bowling actions: pins flying with swift force, bowlers gracefully releasing their balls down the alley, watching as they glide smoothly along the polished lanes, and catching glimpses of bowlers confidently hoisting their chosen balls. The camera captures sliding feet coming to a halt just before the foul line, followed by the ball return mechanism spinning up with a ball ready for its next journey. As the music transitions smoothly into a booming source music emanating from a distant jukebox, the credits conclude over the sound of a clattering strike. A lanky, blonde man with stringy hair, which he has tied back into a ponytail, turns away, having just scored a strike, and casually walks back to join his companions on the bench. The attention then shifts to a large man who is nursing a big plastic cup filled with Budweiser. His dark eyes reflect a worried expression, and his face is adorned with a goatee. His hairy legs are visible, protruding from the khaki shorts he wears, and he sports a khaki army surplus shirt with its sleeves cut off, layered over an old bowling shirt. Returning to the scene is Donny, the bowler who just scored the strike, who enters the area and takes a seat next to Walter. Nearby, the Dude is also holding a large plastic cup of Budweiser, and foam has settled on his mustache. The footage then shows a reflection in a polished plaque, where the Dude is seen entering the room accompanied by a young man. The plaque bears the emblem of Variety Clubs International and celebrates Jeffrey Lebowski as Achiever of the Year. Sporting shorts and a bowling shirt, the Dude turns to look, as does Brandt, the young man dressed in a suit with his hands decorously clasped in front of his groin. The camera tracks and pans to reveal a framed cover of Life Magazine titled "ARE YOU A LEBOWSKI ACHIEVER?" prominently featuring the Dude's face wearing sunglasses, indicating that the entire display is mirrored. Next, a fat man in his sixties, Jeff Lebowski, is shown entering the scene on a motorized wheelchair which he maneuvers behind a desk. The Dude takes a seat facing him, and Brandt quietly retreats from the scene. The Dude then stands up, makes his way to the door, opens it, steps through, and decisively shuts it behind him, cutting off the old man's bellowing voice. Outside, a houseman is seen carrying a rolled-up carpet on one shoulder, leisurely strolling through a back lawn area, past a shimmering swimming pool, and heading toward a garage. Trailing behind him are Brandt and the Dude. They proceed to arc around a woman who is casually finishing painting her nails an eye-catching emerald green, glancing up at the Dude with a curious smile. She is in her early twenties, and she leans back leisurely, extending her leg in his direction. The Dude coolly slides his sunglasses down the bridge of his nose, peering over them to assess the situation before tentatively reaching out to grab hold of her extended foot. In response, she playfully wiggles it, emitting a lighthearted giggle. His gaze then shifts to the pool, where a man in his thirties, whose long stringy blond hair matches the earlier description, is seen passed out in a relaxed state on an inflatable chair floating in the water.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The video opens with music and head credits playing over a montage of dynamic bowling scenes. As the credits end over the sound of a strike, a lanky blonde man ties back his hair, turns from the lane, and walks back to the bench. The focus shifts to a big man with a goatee, sipping a large plastic cup of Bud, dressed in cut-off khaki army gear with hairy legs exposed, sitting near Donny, who joins him after scoring a strike. The Dude, also holding Bud with foam on his mustache, enters the room with a young man, Brandt, reflected in a plaque honoring Jeffrey Lebowski as "Achiever of the Year." The Dude, in shorts and a bowling shirt, and Brandt, in a suit, observe a framed Life Magazine cover featuring the Dude, revealing the display is mirrored. Jeff Lebowski, a man in his sixties, wheels himself into the room. The Dude sits facing him as Brandt leaves, then exits, shutting the door on the old man's shouting. Outside, a houseman carries a rolled-up carpet past a pool to a garage, followed by Brandt and the Dude. They pass a young woman painting her nails, who playfully extends her leg for the Dude to grab as she giggles. Nearby, a man with long blond hair is passed out in an inflatable chair by the pool.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The scenes begin with music and head credits playing over various bowling shots—pins flying, graceful releases, balls gliding down lanes at a popular local alley known for its lively league nights, bowlers hoisting balls, sliding feet, and a ball return spinning up a ball. The music transitions into boomy source music from a distant jukebox, a nostalgic staple in American bowling alleys, as the credits end over a clattering strike. A lanky blonde man with stringy hair tied back in a ponytail, reminiscent of a grunge-era musician's style, turns from the strike to walk back to the bench. The focus shifts to a big man nursing a large plastic cup of Budweiser, a classic American beer brand, with dark worried eyes, a goatee, hairy legs emerging from khaki shorts, and wearing a khaki army surplus shirt with the sleeves cut off over an old bowling shirt. Donny, the strike-scoring bowler, enters and sits next to Walter, his longtime friend and teammate. The Dude, also holding a large plastic cup of Bud, has foam on his mustache. Reflected in a plaque, the Dude is seen entering the room with a young man. The plaque, from Variety Clubs International, a charitable organization supporting children's causes, honors Jeffrey Lebowski as Achiever of the Year. The Dude, wearing shorts and a bowling shirt, turns to look, as does Brandt, the young man in a suit with his hands clasped in front of his groin, signaling professionalism. The track and pan reveal a framed Life Magazine cover titled "ARE YOU A LEBOWSKI ACHIEVER?" with the Dude's sunglassed face on it, showing the display is mirrored. A fat sixtyish man in a motorized wheelchair, Jeff Lebowski, enters, wheeling himself behind a desk, a solid oak fixture that adds to the room's imposing atmosphere. The Dude sits facing him as Brandt withdraws. The Dude rises and heads for the door, opens it, and shuts it on the old man's bellowing. Outside, a houseman with a rolled-up carpet on one shoulder, a task often seen in luxury homes, walks through a back lawn past a swimming pool, a symbol of opulence, to a garage, followed by Brandt and the Dude. They arc around a woman's foot as she finishes painting her nails emerald green, a fashion choice in the early '90s, looking up at the Dude. In her early twenties, she leans back and extends her leg toward him. The Dude pulls his sunglasses down his nose, peeks over them, tentatively grabs hold of her extended foot, and she waggles it, giggling with a flirtatious tone. The Dude looks over at the pool, where a man in his thirties with long stringy blond hair is passed out in an inflatable chair, an image evoking a carefree, if not irresponsible, lifestyle.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)

The music transitions into boomy source music from a distant jukebox as the credits end over a clattering strike. A lanky blonde man with stringy hair tied back in a ponytail turns from the strike to walk back to the bench. The focus shifts to a big man nursing a large plastic cup of Bud with dark worried eyes. a goatee hairy legs emerging from khaki shorts and wearing a khaki army surplus shirt with the sleeves cut off over an old bowling shirt. Donny the strikescoring bowler enters and sits next to Walter. The Dude also holding a large plastic cup of Bud has foam on his mustache. Reflected in a plaque the Dude is seen entering the room with a young man. The plaque from Variety Clubs International honors Jeffrey Lebowski as Achiever of the Year. The Dude wearing shorts and a bowling shirt turns to look as does Brandt. the young man in a suit with his hands clasped in front of his groin. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. The Dude rises and heads for the door opens it and shuts it on the old man's bellowing. Outside a houseman with a rolledup carpet on one shoulder walks through a back lawn past a swimming pool to a garage followed by Brandt and the Dude. They arc around a woman's foot as she finishes painting her nails emerald green looking up at the Dude. In her early twenties she leans back and extends her leg toward him. The Dude pulls his sunglasses down his nose peeks over them tentatively grabs hold of her extended foot and she waggles it giggling. The Dude looks over at the pool where a man in his thirties with long stringy blond hair is passed out in an inflatable chair.

The Dude rises and heads for the door opens it and shuts it on the old man's bellowing. Outside a houseman with a rolledup carpet on one shoulder walks through a back lawn past a swimming pool to a garage followed by Brandt and the Dude. They arc around a woman's foot as she finishes painting her nails emerald green looking up at the Dude. In her early twenties she leans back and extends her leg toward him. The Dude pulls his sunglasses down his nose peeks over them tentatively grabs hold of her extended foot and she waggles it giggling. The Dude looks over at the pool where a man in his thirties with long stringy blond hair is passed out in an inflatable chair.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: The scenes begin with music and head credits playing over various bowling shots—pins flying graceful releases balls gliding down lanes bowlers hoisting balls sliding feet and a ball return spinning up a ball. The music transitions into boomy source music from a distant jukebox as the credits end over a clattering strike. A lanky blonde man with stringy hair tied back in a ponytail turns from the strike to walk back to the bench. The focus shifts to a big man nursing a large plastic cup of Bud with dark worried eyes. a goatee hairy legs emerging from khaki shorts and wearing a khaki army surplus shirt with the sleeves cut off over an old bowling shirt. Donny the strikescoring bowler enters and sits next to Walter. Outside a houseman with a rolledup carpet on one shoulder walks through a back lawn past a swimming pool to a garage followed by Brandt and the Dude. They arc around a woman's foot as she finishes painting her nails emerald green looking up at the Dude. In her early twenties she leans back and extends her leg toward him. The Dude pulls his sunglasses down his nose peeks over them tentatively grabs hold of her extended foot and she waggles it giggling. The Dude looks over at the pool where a man in his thirties with long stringy blond hair is passed out in an inflatable chair.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The episodes commence with laughter and main titles displaying across various pinball plays—buttons smashing, awkward tosses, flippers bouncing around bumpers, players smacking flippers, hopping fingers, and a coin slot ejecting a coin. The laughter shifts into distant chatter from a nearby arcade as the titles conclude over a rumbling tilt. A short brunette woman with curly hair tied back in a braid swivels from the tilt to hop back to the stool. The emphasis switches to a tiny woman cradling a massive ceramic mug of tea, with bright excited eyes, pigtails, furry socks sticking out from denim pants, and sporting a denim aviation jacket with the collar frayed over a brand-new cycling jersey. Connie, the tilt-achieving player, enters and plops down next to Lisa. The Cat, also holding a massive ceramic mug of tea, has sprinkles on its whiskers. Reflected in a mirror, the Cat is seen entering the arcade with an elderly lady. The mirror, from Global Entertainment Federation, praises Felicity Cat as Innovator of the Century. The Cat, wearing pants and a cycling jersey, pivots to glance, as does Trevor, the elderly lady in a kimono with her hands folded in front of her waist. The zoom and camera move disclose a mounted Science Journal cover titled "ARE YOU A FELICITY INNOVATOR?" with the Cat's spectacled face on it, revealing the presentation is flipped. A thin teenager in a pedal-powered go-kart, Manu Felicity, arrives, pedaling himself behind a table. The Cat perches facing him as Trevor departs. The Cat stands and strolls toward the exit, flings it open, and slams it on the teenager's hollering. Outdoors, a deliveryman with a bundled parachute on one arm wanders through a front garden past a fountain to a barn, trailed by Trevor and the Cat. They weave around a man's elbow as he finishes sketching his shoes royal blue, gazing down at the Cat. In his fifties, he reclines forward and retracts his arm toward them. The Cat nudges its spectacles down its ears, peers above them, cautiously clasps hold of his retracting elbow, and he shakes it, chuckling. The Cat glances over at the fountain, where a woman in her seventies with short bouncy red hair is dozing off in a rubber boat.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The video opens with music and credits over bowling scenes: pins crashing, bowlers in action, and a ball return. The music fades to jukebox tunes as credits conclude with a strike. A lanky blonde man, Donny, scores and joins Walter, a big man with dark eyes and a goatee, drinking a large Bud. The Dude, also with a Bud, has foam on his mustache. Reflected in a plaque, he is seen with a young man. The plaque honors Jeffrey Lebowski as Achiever of the Year. The Dude, in shorts and a bowling shirt, looks at a Life Magazine cover with his face titled "ARE YOU A LEBOWSKI ACHIEVER?" Jeff Lebowski, a sixtyish man in a motorized wheelchair, enters, and the Dude sits facing him. The Dude leaves, ignoring Lebowski's bellow. Outside, the Dude follows the houseman and Brandt, who arc around a woman painting her nails. In her twenties, she extends her leg to the Dude, who tentatively holds her foot as she giggles. Nearby, a man with long blond hair is passed out in a pool chair.
